ABOUT ME

I'm creative Front End Developer

Ashish Singh


Welcome to my website. I am a Front End Developer with an experience of creating responsive websites that allow the user to experience it in the best and most appropriate way suited to the device they are using. Cross browser compatibility is ensured by using feature detection so older browsers still in use today provide a solid experience.
Rather than creating websites on a page-by-page basis, I instead consider each element of the screen-based designs as separate components which helps in a reusable and maintainable code base.
I can quickly and efficiently integrate in a team with methods and tools such as Git, Agile/Scrum, and test/behaviour driven development.

I collaborate with peers to nurture and transform ideas into well thought out design specs. I love coding things from scratch, but I can work with front-end frameworks.

Various tools that I have used during the course of development are listed below:
- Apache and NodeJS live server as a localhost
- NPM and Bower for dependency management
- GIT and TFS for version control
- XAMPP as a web server solution stack package
- Sublime Text 3 as a text editor

Technologies used for the web development are listed below:
- HTML
- CSS
- Javascript
    - AngularJS
    - Angular Material
- Typescript
- Animation

Over the years, I have consistently participated in various events and competitions. Some of them are listed below:
- 3rd National Rank in International Olympiad of Mathematics, 2011
- PAT on BACK for demonstrating excellent analytical skills for Customer issues and closing them with good quality (Siemens)
- Chief Event Manager at the annual technical fest Renaissance 2013 structured by the IET where my responsibilities included Event Designing, Marketing and Overall Management

FUN@WORK

When I am not coding, I love to play chess, table tennis and cricket. I have partcipated in various team events organised at workplace.

This website is designed using AngularJS, Angular Material, Typescript, HTML5 and CSS3.
